verses.text_plain: Hear ye now what the Lord saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.
verses.verse_html:
1Hear ye now what the Lord saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice. ▼
▼ before: or, with

verses.text_plain: Hear ye, O mountains, the Lord’s controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the Lord hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.
verses.verse_html: 2Hear ye, O mountains, the Lord’s controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the Lord hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.

verses.text_plain: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.
verses.verse_html: 3O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.

tokens.text: unto thee? and wherein have I wearied

verses.text_plain: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
verses.verse_html: 4For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

verses.text_plain: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 5O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Wherewith shall I come before the Lord, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old?
verses.verse_html:
6Wherewith shall I come before the Lord, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old? ▼
▼ of a…: Heb. sons of a year?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ of a…: Heb. sons of a year?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ of a…: Heb. sons of a year?

verses.text_plain: Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
verses.verse_html:
7Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul? ▼
▼ body: Heb. belly

verses.text_plain: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?
verses.verse_html:
8He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God? ▼
▼ walk…: Heb. humble thyself to walk

footnotes.body_text: ▼ walk…: Heb. humble thyself to walk
footnotes.body_html: ▼ walk…: Heb. humble thyself to walk

verses.text_plain: The Lord’s voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.
verses.verse_html:
9The Lord’s voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it. ▼
▼ the man…: or, thy name shall see that which is

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the man…: or, thy name shall see that which is
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the man…: or, thy name shall see that which is

verses.text_plain: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable?
verses.verse_html:
10Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable? ▼
▼ Are…: or, Is there yet unto every man an house of the, etc
 , ▼
▼ scant…: Heb. measure of leanness

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Are…: or, Is there yet unto every man an house of the, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Are…: or, Is there yet unto every man an house of the, etc
▼ scant…: Heb. measure of leanness

verses.text_plain: Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights?
verses.verse_html:
11Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights? ▼
▼ count…: or, be pure with, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ count…: or, be pure with, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ count…: or, be pure with, etc

verses.text_plain: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
verses.verse_html: 12For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.

verses.text_plain: Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.
verses.verse_html: 13Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.
verses.verse_html: 14Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.

tokens.text: of thee; and thou shalt take hold

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.
verses.verse_html: 15Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.

verses.text_plain: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
verses.verse_html:
16For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people. ▼
▼ For the…: or, For he doth much keep the, etc
 , ▼
▼ desolation: or, astonishment

footnotes.body_text: ▼ For the…: or, For he doth much keep the, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ For the…: or, For he doth much keep the, etc
